page.title: 04TRANSPORT IN CHILMARK
page.content: {Public transport}serving Chilmark and Teffont consists of a{limited bus service. Six buses a day each way from Salisbury to Hindon,fewer on Saturday and none on Sunday are augmented by a {special shopping bus}into Salisbury on market days, Tuesday and Saturday and a bus to Tisbury on Friday paid for by Tisbury Traders. A trial service to Warminster has been running on Friday. A late flexible bus runs from Salibury on weekdays. The nearest{railway station}is at Tisbury, with trains to Waterloo and Exeter. Few people use{bicycles;}most use{private cars.}There is easy access to the A303 trunk road, 3 miles to the north. A network of{footpaths}and {bridlepaths}is evidence of how people got around in the past. ANNE McGRAIL
